content.question: If a trapezoidal sum overapproximates <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mn>4</mn> </msubsup> <mi>f</mi> </mrow> </mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F92@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, and a right Riemann sum underapproximates <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mn>4</mn> </msubsup> <mi>f</mi> </mrow> </mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F92@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, which of the following could be the graph of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3BA8@</annotation> </semantics> </math>?

choices.label: The five answer choices are all graphs of f(x) drawn in the first quadrant, scaled for both x and y from 0 to 4.  a) The graph is asymptotic to both the y-axis for values of x close to 0, and the x-axis as x gets large.  The graph is decreasing and concave up in quadrant 1.

The five answer choices are all graphs of f(x) drawn in the first quadrant, scaled for both x and y from 0 to 4. b) The graph starts at the origin and is increasing and concave down in the first quadrant.

The five answer choices are all graphs of f(x) drawn in the first quadrant, scaled for both x and y from 0 to 4. The graph intersects the y-axis at an undetermined value between 3 and 4.  It is decreasing and concave down.

The five answer choices are all graphs of f(x) drawn in the first quadrant, scaled for both x and y from 0 to 4. The graph intersects the y-axis at an undetermined value between 0 and 1.  It is increasing and concave up.
The five answer choices are all graphs of f(x) drawn in the first quadrant, scaled for both x and y from 0 to 4. The graph is a line passing through the origin and the point (4,4).

content.answer: The five answer choices are all graphs of f(x) drawn in the first quadrant, scaled for both x and y from 0 to 4.  a) The graph is asymptotic to both the y-axis for values of x close to 0, and the x-axis as x gets large.  The graph is decreasing and concave up in quadrant 1.

skill.text: Skill 1.F: Explain how an approximated value relates to the actual value.
